snippet: Hezbollah’s leader, Hassan Nasrallah, suggested Syria would retaliate by providing his fighters with weapons that Israel wanted to keep out of the group’s hands.
abstract: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah escalates tensions with Israel over recent Israeli air strikes near Damascus; suggests Syria would retaliate by providing his fighters with weapons that Israel wanted to keep out of the group’s hands.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem, Steven Erlanger from Paris, Steven Lee Myers from Rome, Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hezbollah’s leader, Hassan Nasrallah, suggested Syria would retaliate by providing his fighters with weapons that Israel wanted to keep out of the group’s hands.

headline.seo: Hezbollah Threatens Israel Over Syria Strikes
headline.main: Hezbollah Threatens Israel Over Syria Strikes
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Threatens Israel Over Airstrikes in Syria
